title: PowerShell Core Build System and Development Workflow
body:
Understanding the PowerShell build system is essential for contributors and advanced users:

**Build Prerequisites:**
- .NET 8.0 SDK or later
- Git for source control
- Platform-specific tools (Windows SDK, build-essential on Linux)

**Build Commands:**
```powershell
# Import build module
Import-Module ./build.psm1

# Full build
Start-PSBuild

# Build for specific configuration
Start-PSBuild -Configuration Release

# Cross-platform build
Start-PSBuild -CrossGen  # Enable crossgen optimization

# Build with specific runtime
Start-PSBuild -Runtime win-x64
```

**Key Build Components:**
- **ResGen**: Generates resource files from .resx
- **TypeCatalogGen**: Creates type catalogs for better performance
- **crossgen2**: Ahead-of-time compilation for improved startup
- **Dummy dependencies**: Flexible dependency management system

**Testing Integration:**
```powershell
# Run PowerShell tests
Start-PSPester -Path test/powershell

# Run with specific tags
Start-PSPester -Tag CI -ExcludeTag Slow

# Run xUnit tests  
Start-PSxUnit

# Package tests
Start-PSPackage -Type msi  # Windows
Start-PSPackage -Type deb  # Debian/Ubuntu
Start-PSPackage -Type rpm  # RedHat/CentOS
```

**Module Development:**
```powershell
# Generate module manifest
New-ModuleManifest -Path MyModule.psd1 -ModuleVersion "1.0.0"

# Test module loading
Import-Module ./MyModule -Force -Verbose

# Publish to PowerShell Gallery
Publish-Module -Name MyModule -Repository PSGallery
```

**Debugging Build Issues:**
- Check build logs in artifacts directory
- Use -Verbose for detailed build output  
- Verify .NET SDK version compatibility
- Clean build artifacts with Start-PSBuild -Clean

**Development Environment:**
```powershell
# Setup development environment
./tools/installpsh-osx.sh    # macOS
./tools/installpsh-debian.sh # Debian/Ubuntu

# Use VS Code with PowerShell extension
code --install-extension ms-vscode.PowerShell

# Configure PowerShell for development
$profile | ni -Force
# Add development-specific configuration
```

**CI/CD Integration:**
- Azure Pipelines configuration in .vsts-ci/
- Automated testing on Windows, Linux, macOS
- Package generation and signing
- Release deployment automation
